name: DoubleTree by Hilton Istanbul - Old Town

reviews.text: The goodness of a hotel is not measured by its amenities. That has become an expectation that bears little discrimination among good hotels. The real goodness of a hotel is measured by its personality. Staff are the most important element of any good hotel and the DoubleTree at Old Town in Istanbul sets the bar. Consistently, I have been treated well here. Burak, who runs the food service section, is sociable and a gentleman. He will welcome you and make you feel at home. The restaurant staff are attentive. The location of this hotel could not be better. A one minute walk to the tram. Five minutes you are at the Grand Bazaar. Ten minutes you can be at Sulyaname Mosque. Without question this hotel is excellent. One downside - but this is true of all the Hilton properties - is the internet service. I do receive it complimentary as a Diamond member. But I do not like Swisscom.
reviews.title: Consistently Excellent Service
Excellent Stay
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of April and I would not hesitate one bit to stay at this property again. Staff was extremely friendly from the moment we arrived. I would request a corner room if available as I believe they may be a bit larger from reading some other comments about the rooms being small. Our corner room was a street front room but if you close the windows and use the A/C it is not bothersome at night. The breakfast is amazing and the in room wifi is very reliable, both are complimentary for gold level and above. The spa and workout room are also both well equipped. You cannot beat the location in the Old Town as all the major sites are within walking distance and there is a tram stop right out the front door if needed. Being this was our first visit to Istanbul I did not see another location around town I'd have preferred to be staying in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great if you want to be on the tramline (altho it's 4-5 stops and 3TL oneway to the Blue Mosque etc or a ~1 mile walk). There's good shopping just west of the hotel (I liked Koton - sort of like Turkish Zara and Forever 21 combined). Rooms at the back of the hotel are quiet, toiletries are nice, and robes/towels plush. The hotel staff is great - they provide great advice quickly and professionally.
reviews.title: Good location near tram, Quiet rooms at back of hotel, Helpful staff

reviews.text: As diamond members, we received breakfast and wifi at no charge. The breakfast buffet is extensive and it's easy to eat gluten-free or low-carb if you're into that as it's stuffed with proteins like cheeses, eggs made to order and fresh fruits and veg. The scrambled eggs that are sitting on the buffet take soupy to a whole new level. They're gross. Just order an omelette from the chef and skip the nasty, runny eggs. Also, as always, the Doubletree warm cookies didn't disappoint upon check in.
reviews.title: Location was very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the wifi, it's incredibly fast, but it's a pain in the rear to enter a specific code and username for each device you use on a daily basis. Seriously, there's got to be a better system than that.
reviews.title: Great location, excellent staff, modern/new facilities

reviews.text: I loved the DoubleTree by Hilton Istanbul Old Town. Although a room was not available when I arrived at 10am, the hotel staff kept checking in with me periodically, offering tea and cookies, until a room could be made ready. I couldn't have asked for more in this respect.
reviews.title: Unparalleled Service and Location

reviews.text: The room, a King Deluxe, was more than spacious enough for one person and I really liked the modern bathroom. The shower area was interesting and had high enough water pressure to make me happy.
reviews.title: Many better options in town

reviews.text: The breakfast each morning in the lobby restaurant was extensive and delicious, and included for Hilton HHonors Gold members. This was a great way to fuel up at the beginning of the day for a long, fun-filled day of sightseeing.
reviews.title: Amazing staff, noisy room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One day I tried out the hammam in the hotel and enjoyed the Turkish bath experience. It was awesome. I know it was a bit on the pricey side, but I had the place all to myself. As I was finishing, a couple came in, so perhaps I would have been a little self-conscious being half naked in a co-ed environment.
reviews.title: Calm in the heart of bustling Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great - walking distance to the tram and the Grand Bazaar. I like to walk, so it was enjoyable for me to keep walking to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque.
reviews.title: Quiet hotel in a busy city
Not as good as I expected
reviews.text: This was my second trip to Istanbul, I changed hotels which was a mistake! A disappointing small room , twin beds but not much room to walk around and nowhere to sit! The sheets weren't changed, I cut my foot on the first day and the blood was on the sheets for the whole 5 nights! Staff at reception and in the bar were very helpful and polite. However, the bar prices are ridiculous! Food OK but much better value and quality is available outside of the hotel. I'm back in Istanbul in September but I unfortunately feel I will be returning to my first experience, just down the road.

reviews.title: Rather average business hotel lacking any charm or history appeal
reviews.text: We stayed for 6 nights due to a job assignment. The room we were assigned in level two had a window facing a narrow inner interstitial space with views of the nearby building white wall. All about 2 metres wide enough to fit a couple of massive industrial like fans which produced an unbearable noise. Immediately complained about it and we were promptly transfered to another room with no other views than those of the reception and business area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was almost empty, but we were unlucky enough so as to have to watch a scene offered by a customer complaining about the personnel "trying to fit her into a yellow taxi" while she apparently had expected "a proper car with her name on it and a driver".
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: Wifi was available but a hefty 25 TL per day.
reviews.title: Doubletree-Old Town Istanbul

reviews.text: I would qualify this hotel as a 3 star hotel, with a misleading pretentious prices strategy.
reviews.title: Istanbul rocks and Double Tree in Old Town does too !)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Doubletree Old Town for four nights last month. The rooms were somewhat small but excellent location – just across from a tram stop. We were able to easily get back to the hotel for a quick rest before going on the next venture. It is walking distance to most of the main attractions. If you did not want to walk it is 2 or 3 tram stops. The best part of the hotel was the Turkish bath. It is free for guest along with the hot tub, sauna, steam room etc. I never took a shower in the room - always here, sometimes twice a day.
reviews.title: Great Location great Turkish bath

reviews.text: Booked this hotel via Hilton.com. After booking it I found that there was a cheaper rate ay another web site and Hilton honored their “rate guarantee” and matched the rate. Then the Hotel sent me an e-mail basically telling me that the rate is the higher rate and not willing to honor the rate match. I contacted Hilton and they must have called the hotel and straightened things out. I also sent an e-mail to the hotel with my confirmation and the rate to the hotel. They eventually accepted it. Did not have any issues at check-in or check-out, charged the correct price (not that it was a big difference).
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The one area they need an improvement is in house cleaning. We had to call every day for something, towels, glasses, water. When we ask the towels not be replaced they still take it away but no replacement. One day we must have accidently had the “do not disturb” sign side instead of “make the room” side (or a prankster turned it around – I can see myself doing something like that when I was a teen – which is why it should be 2 separate cards). When we entered the room we saw a card they had slipped through the door stating that the room was not cleaned as we had the sign out. About 7:00p we got a call from house-keeping and asked if we needed anything. We were fine with the towels and sheets but did ask for some water. Never got it! It was a nice gesture for them to call but why did they not follow through with it?
reviews.title: Fantastic Location, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They do not have free Wi-Fi but do have a business center where you can use a computer and get on the internet.
reviews.title: Great Service, Great Location

reviews.text: All and all it is really nice – great location great Turkish bath. I don’t recall eating at the hotel restaurant – after all why – hundreds of places within walking distance at half the price or better.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms and excellent breakfast

aka: Doubletree By Hilton Istanbul - Old Town Hotel Istanbul
description: Explore nearby museums and Istanbul attractions from the DoubleTree by Hilton Istanbul – Old Town hotel. Located in Istanbul's central historical district, this Istanbul hotel is just 20 minutes east of Ataturk International Airport and a five minute walk from Istanbul's famous Grand Bazaar. Thoughtfully designed to blend into the Old City.
